definition: to demote (to a lower rank)
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
to surrender/to capitulate/to subdue/to tame
office/duty

sentences.english: He was demoted and was transferred from Taipei branch to Kaohsiung branch.
sentences.chinese: 他被降职并从台北分公司调职到高雄分公司。

sentences.english: Be transferred from the Ministry of Commerce Ambassador demoted?
sentences.chinese: 调离商务部驻华大使算是降职？

sentences.english: Promotions and demotions were zealously monitored.
sentences.chinese: 受疯狂监视的升职和降职。

sentences.english: He was put down from the office for peculation.
sentences.chinese: 他因侵吞公款而被降职。

sentences.english: The head nurse was reduced to ordinary nurse due to malpractice.
sentences.chinese: 这位护士长由于玩忽职守被降职为普通护士。

sentences.english: Wadsworth group described the degraded regeneration of entanglement and renewable.
sentences.chinese: 再生巨流描述被降职的男人的纠葛和再生。

sentences.english: She says she was demoted and then sacked after complaining to the Commission.
sentences.chinese: 她向平机会投诉后，被降职，然后被解雇。

definition: to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to demote
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to be transferred to another post/to post away
(of an official) to lose one's job
promote/promotion
to promote (sb)/to upgrade/to ascend
to send away to serve a penal sentence
to dismiss from office/to resign from office
demotion to commoner (idiom)
restored to one's official post/to send sb back to his former post
to forfeit one's salary
to demote an official/a demoted official
to dismiss/to discharge/to fire
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
